From: "Barry Thomas" <warlord@...>

Dear Shishi,

I have consulted E. Papinot's "Historical and Geographical Dictionary of Japan"
on your question (it is all I have!!) and found the following:

> Ise no Saburo
No reference.

> the Sato brothers
page 547:  "Sato: Daimyo family, descended from Fujiwara Hidesato, possesing the
fief of Shinobu (Mutsu) since the 11th century.  Besides Saigyo-Hoshi, the best
known members of the family are the two brothers Tsuginobu (1158-1185) and
Tadanobu (1160-1185), sons of Motoharu.  They both belonged to the 4 bodyguards
(shi-tenno) of Miyamoto Yoshitsune, and died in his cause."

> the Kamada brothers???
No reference.

Regards,

Warlord.

----- Original Message -----
From: Yoshitsune Lion <akodo99@...>
To: <samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Friday, September 21, 2001 1:03 AM
Subject: [samuraihistory] minamoto yoshitsune


I was wondering if anyone could tell me if it is known how minamoto
yoshitsune came to meet his other vassels of -
Ise no Saburo
the Sato brothers and
the Kamada brothers???
I have been unable to find any historical reference to how they came
together! Also does anyone know the names of the kamada bros??

Thankyou
